Title:
A taxonomic revision of the genus Conidiobolus
(Ancylistaceae, Entomophthorales): four clades including three new
genera
Keywords:
Zygomycetes  Entomophthorales  Morphylogy  Phylogeny  New
taxa
Abstract:
Conidiobolus is an important and special group in
entomophthoroid fungi, and considered to be polyphyletic in recent
molecular phylogenies. To revaluate and delimit the genus Conidiobolus,
multi-locus phylogenetic analyses were performed using the large subunit
of nuclear ribosomal RNA (nucLSU), the small subunit of nuclear
ribosomal RNA (nucSSU), the small subunit of the mitochondrial ribosomal
RNA (mtSSU) and the translation elongation factor 1-alpha (EF-1α). The
result conformed that the Conidiobolus is not monophyletic, being
grouped into four clades, with a recovered genus Delacroixia and three
new genera Microconidiobolus, Capillidium, and Neoconidiobolus.
Consequently, several new combinations were proposed.
